required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Diagnostic Yield of Transvaginal Ultrasonography Versus Sonohysterography in Detection of Ceserean Section Niche
clinical_study.official_title: Diagnostic Yield of Transvaginal Ultrasonography Versus Sonohysterography in the Evaluation of Ceserean Section Niche.

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to compare the identification of CS scar niche between 2D transvaginal ultrasonography alone and with the use of saline infusion as a contrast. Does it differ in the measurements and identification or not.

detailed_description.textblock: Cesarean section (CS) rate is increasing in recent practice with a corresponding increase in associated complication. One of these complications is the CS scar defect or 'niche'. A niche forms after CS at the site of hysterotomy of the anterior uterine wall. Recently, it has been demonstrated that niche may be the causative factor for abnormal uterine bleeding, dysmenorrhea, obstetric complications in subsequent pregnancies and possibly subfertility. Therefore, the accurate measurement and description of a niche is becoming increasingly important, for the clinical assessment of gynecological symptoms and for the planning of possible surgical treatment.A niche can be examined using two- (2D) or three- (3D) dimensional transvaginal sonography (TVS), with or without saline or gel contrast, magnetic resonance imaging and hysteroscopy. We will examine about 30 patients of non pregnant women with previous CS having gynecological complications or seeking fertility. All participants will be subjected to 2D vaginal examination to exclude uterine pathology followed by 2D transvaginal ultrasonography with saline infusion using 10-20 ml of sterile Na Cl 0.9% solution injected through the cervix using a 2 mm sterile disposable catheter or IOL Foley catheter. The procedure will be done postmenstrually.

primary_outcome.measure: accurate evaluation of CS section niche
primary_outcome.time_frame: 6 months from the date of approval
primary_outcome.description: comparison of imaging CS niche by 2D transvaginal US and sonohysterography

intervention.description: saline infusion transvaginally followed by 2D transvaginal ultrasound imaging

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- women with previous CS section scar seeking pregnancy or having gynecological complications
Exclusion Criteria:
- women having other gynecological pathology other than niche
